author: Special Correspondent
text:
Hundreds of students and political workers held a protest march on Monday from Mumbai’s Jijamata Udyaan to CST highlighting institutional culpability in Rohith Vemula’s suicide.

A Joint Action Committee of student groups from different educational institutions, formed after Rohith, the Dalit research scholar student of Hyderabad Central University, committed suicide last month, organised the march. The students demanded the removal of Union Labour Minister Bandaru Dattatreya, HRD Minister Smriti Irani, Hyderabad university vice-chancellor P Appa Rao, university’s chief proctor professor Alok Pandey and BJP MLC Ramchandra Rao. They also demanded their arrest along with ABVP leader Susheel Kumar under the SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act.

“There is a groundswell of support for Rohith in the country,” TISS student Yashwant Zagade told The Hindu .
title: Mumbai students intensify protest
